Latinx in AI Coalition at ICML 2019

The Official LXAI Research Workshop is co-located with ICML at the Long Beach Convention Center in Long Beach, CA on Monday, June 10th, 2019.

Call for Participation

The workshop is a one-day event with invited speakers, oral presentations, and posters. The event brings together faculty, graduate students, research scientists, and engineers for an opportunity to connect and exchange ideas. There will be a panel discussion and a mentoring session to discuss current research trends and career choices in artificial intelligence and machine learning. While all presenters will identify primarily as latinx, all are invited to attend.

Creating Opportunity for Latinx in AI

Important Dates

  • March 22, 2019: Travel grant application extended deadline
  • March 22, 2019: Abstract submission extended deadline
  • March 11, 2019: Program Committee application deadline
  • March 29, 2019: Abstract Review deadline
  • April 1, 2019: Notification of submission acceptance
  • April 10, 2019: Visa application deadline
  • May 1, 2019: ICML registration opens at 8am
  • June 14, 2019: LXAI Workshop
Travel Grant Application

Submission Instructions

We strongly encourage students, post-docs and researchers who primarily identify as latinx in all areas of machine learning to submit an abstract describing new, previously, or concurrently published research. We welcome abstract submissions, in theory, methodology, as well as applications. Abstracts may describe completed research or work-in-progress. While the presenting author need not be the first author of the work, we encourage authors to highlight the contribution of latinx individuals — particularly the presenting author — in the abstract.

Authors of accepted abstracts will be asked to present their work in a poster session. A few authors will be selected to give 15 minute oral presentations. Submissions will be peer-reviewed. Authors are encouraged to sign up to review for LXAI, with a sign-up option available upon submission.

Submission Guidelines

Submissions may be up to two pages including all figures and tables, with an additional page for references submitted as a link to a PDF. The submissions should be in a single column. They should be typeset using 11-point or larger fonts and should have at least 1-inch margin all around. Submissions that do not follow these guidelines risk being rejected without consideration of their merits. Submissions must state the research problem, motivation, and technical contribution. Submissions must be self-contained and include all figures, tables, and references.

The submission deadline is 11:59 PM (PST), March 22, 2019. Please note that no extensions will be offered for submissions.

Submit Abstract

Logistics

Attending ICML

Please notes that an abstract acceptance in LXAI and/or registration to attend LXAI does not guarantee access to ICML. You have to register to attend ICML separately ( https://icml.cc/Register/view-registration).

As a result, we would like to inform you that ICML registration will sell out quickly. If you are planning to attend ICML, we want to encourage you to register now. You can cancel your registration for a full refund until May 27th if you end up not being able to attend. ( https://icml.cc/Help/CancellationPolicy).

We also encourage you to book your accommodation as the discounted room blocks are being filled up quickly.

Accommodations

You may take advantage of ICML group hotel rates, provided here. In the past, workshop participants have also used Airbnb and hostels.

Hotel cancellation policy should be checked with the hotels.

LXAI is not responsible for information provided on external websites.

More Visa Information

A visa invitation letter comes with the ICML registration. If you don’t have the ICML visa invitation letter, we can also provide you Invitation letters upon successful registration to the LXAI workshop. To know more about the appointment waiting times for interviews check this page. And for a list of waiting times per consulates in different latin countries check this google doc.

Child Care Available

KiddieCorp is pleased to provide a children’s program during the June 2019 ICML Conference. All participants requesting child care should fill out this form and mention "LatinX in AI participant" in the "additional information box" by 10 May 2019 to reserve a spot.

The LXAI Workshop at ICML is only one of the many research and engineering programs our organization is hosting. Please visit our main page to learn more about Latinx in AI initiatives around the world.
